First, we need to gather some information. According to the Philadelphia Inquirer, an average of 140,000 people pass through 30th Street Station every day. 

Next, we need to consider the size of Dorton Arena. It has a seating capacity of 7,610 people, which means it can comfortably seat 7,610 people at one time.

Now, we can do some calculations. If we divide the number of people who pass through 30th Street Station each day (140,000) by the seating capacity of Dorton Arena (7,610), we get approximately 18.4. This means that we would need to fill Dorton Arena and empty it 18 times to fit all of the people who pass through 30th Street Station every day.

Since it is not possible to fill and empty an arena 18 times in one day, the answer is no - all of the people who pass through 30th Street Station every day could not fit in Dorton Arena. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) no.

First, we need to determine the capacity of 30th Street Station and Dorton Arena. According to Amtrak, 30th Street Station processes over 4 million passengers annually. Assuming an even distribution, that would be over 10,000 people per day. 

Next, we need to determine the capacity of Dorton Arena. The arena is located in the North Carolina State Fairgrounds and has a seating capacity of 7,610 people. However, we need to consider the standing room floor space as well. According to the North Carolina State Fair website, the building has 150,000 square feet of space. Assuming an average person takes up 4 square feet of space, we can calculate the maximum occupancy to be 37,500 people. 

So, can all the people who pass through 30th Street Station every day fit in Dorton Arena? No, because the maximum capacity of Dorton Arena is only 37,500 people, which is far lower than the 10,000 people who pass through 30th Street Station every day.

Dorton Arena is a multi-purpose indoor arena located in Raleigh, North Carolina. Its seating capacity is approximately 7,610 people. 

So, if we divide the number of daily commuters at 30th Street Station by the seating capacity of Dorton Arena, we get 1.57. This means that it would take almost 2 full Dorton Arenas to accommodate all of the people who pass through 30th Street Station each day. 

Therefore, the answer to the question is (B) no, all of the people who pass through 30th Street Station every day could not fit in Dorton Arena.

First, we need to know the capacity of 30th Street Station and Dorton Arena. According to sources, 30th Street Station has an average daily ridership of over 70,000 people. On the other hand, the Dorton Arena has a maximum seating capacity of 7,610 people.

Next, we need to determine if the capacity of Dorton Arena can accommodate the number of people who pass through 30th Street Station every day. We can calculate this by dividing the number of people who pass through 30th Street Station every day by the seating capacity of Dorton Arena:

70,000 / 7,610 = 9.18

This calculation means that the capacity of Dorton Arena is only enough to accommodate 9% of the number of people who pass through 30th Street Station every day. Therefore, the answer to the question is (B) no, not all of the people who pass through 30th Street Station every day can fit in Dorton Arena.

To answer this question, we need to determine the capacities of both 30th Street Station and Dorton Arena, and then compare them. 

30th Street Station, located in Philadelphia, is one of the busiest train stations in the United States. According to Amtrak, the station serves around 4 million passengers annually, which averages out to approximately 10,958 passengers per day. 

Dorton Arena, on the other hand, is an indoor arena located in Raleigh, North Carolina. Its seating capacity varies depending on the type of event being held, but typically ranges from 5,000 to 7,000 people. 

Based on these numbers, it is evident that Dorton Arena is not large enough to accommodate all the people who pass through 30th Street Station on a daily basis. Even if we assume that every single person who passes through the station is a unique individual (which is unlikely, as many people use the station for transfer purposes only), the numbers simply don't add up. 

Therefore, the correct answer is (B) no.

First, we need to determine the capacity of 30th Street Station and Dorton Arena. According to Amtrak, 30th Street Station has an average volume of around 120,000 passengers per day, and Dorton Arena in Raleigh, North Carolina, has a capacity of 7,610 seats. 

To determine if all of the people who pass through 30th Street Station can fit in Dorton Arena, we need to calculate how many people can fit in Dorton Arena per day. Assuming that Dorton Arena operates 24/7 and seats can be filled continuously, the maximum number of people who can pass through Dorton Arena in a day is 7,610 x 24 = 182,640.

Comparing the capacity of Dorton Arena to the number of people who pass through 30th Street Station, we can see that even if every seat in Dorton Arena is filled continuously for 24 hours, it is not enough to accommodate the number of people passing through 30th Street Station every day. 

Therefore, the answer is (B) no, all of the people who pass through 30th Street Station every day cannot fit in Dorton Arena.
